quote: Captain's log, stardate 41636.9.   As feared, our examination of the   seven year overdue Federation   freighter, Odin -- disabled by   an asteroid collision -- revealed   no survivors.
However, three escape pods were   missing, suggesting the   possibility of survivors...
Ready to begin orbit of Angel One,   Captain.
Make it so, Mister La Forge. What   kind of place is this, Data?

Angel One is a class M planet,   supporting carbon-based flora and   fauna, sparsely populated with   intelligent life forms... similar   in technological development to   mid-twentieth-century Earth.
Just like being marooned at home.

Assuming any survivors made it   this far. Admittedly, it's the   closest planet to the Odin. But   the distance we've traveled in the   past two days at warp one would've   taken the Odin escape pods five   months.
Five months, fourteen days, eleven   hours, two minutes --
Thank you, Data.
-- and fifty-seven seconds.
Captain, we're receiving an audio   signal from Angel One.

Starfleet was quite adamant that   we maintain excellent diplomatic   relations with this planet. Any   other pertinent information before   we reply, Mister Data? Their form   of government would be a logical   starting place.

Angel One has evolved into a   constitutional oligarchy. It is   governed by a parliamentary body   consisting of six elected   Mistresses, and headed by a female   they refer to as "The Elected   One."
It sounds very much like my own   planet.
Klingons appreciate strong women.
How current is your information,   Data?
A Federation vessel last visited   this planet sixty-two years ago,   Captain.
Except, let us hope, for the Odin   escape pods.       Since this is a female-dominated   society, it might be more prudent   if you made the initial contact,   Counselor.
Please open hailing frequencies.
Hailing frequencies open.
This is Counselor Deanna Troi of   the USS Enterprise.
I am Beata, The Elected One. How   may we assist you, Counselor?
The Federation has neglected a   visit to your planet for far too   long. With your permission, we   would like to correct that   oversight.
We feel in no way neglected,   Counselor. A diplomatic courtesy   call is neither expected nor   required.
We also come in search of possible   survivors from one of our   freighters.
A brief visit will be tolerated.
They've broken off transmission.
Ever feel like you're not really   wanted?
That's their prerogative,   Lieutenant.       Prepare the away team, Number One.
Aye, aye, sir.
Where're you boys off to?
Skiing, sir. Our instructor has   us scheduled for the Swiss Alps,   sir.
Save us some deep powder.
No problem, sir. The Holodeck   has all you'll ever need.
The away team is ready, Captain.
Angel One's position in this   quadrant may become strategically   vital. The hope at Starfleet is   that some day this planet could   become a part of the Federation.
We'll try to make a good impression,   Captain.
Energize!
See that these matters are handled   immediately.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: As you wish, Mistress.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: I am Beata, The Elected One of   Angel One.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: Mistress Beata, I am Counselor   Troi.       We've brought you a small token   of our goodwill.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: My cooperation is not for sale,   Counselor.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: We didn't mean to imply that it   was, Mistress.       Out of respect to your wishes that   we keep our visit brief, perhaps   you would like to address the   issue of survivors immediately.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: Immediately -- but not   impetuously. You will present   your case.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: Until I am certain of your   intentions, I know of no such   survivors.
scene: 7    INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - DAY

quote: Representatives of the Starship   Enterprise -- do you wish to   petition the Parliament of Angel   One?
We do. We have reason to hope   that survivors from a damaged   Federation freighter may be   marooned on your planet. We are   seeking to learn if this is so.
Even a planet as remote as Angel   One has heard of Starfleet.   Searching the galaxy for survivors   seems a petty task for one of their   mighty vessels.
We don't consider even one   survivor petty.
Is this man suggesting that we   place a lesser value on life than   you do?
Not at all.
Our discovery of the abandoned   freighter was an accident,   Mistress Beata. We have a duty   to investigate.
I see. And if you were to find   survivors? What then?
We will take them with us. See   that they are reunited with their   families.
Mistress Beata... ?
Yes, Ariel?
Are we to take these strangers   at their word?
A good question.
What reason could we possibly have   to deceive you?
Another good question.
Are there survivors from the   freighter Odin on this planet?
After we discuss that matter,   we'll let you know.
See to their comforts.
You will remain here until   summoned.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Are we able to talk? Is the   area secure?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Yes. Tricorder doesn't show   any listening devices or   anything else of a threatening   nature
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Good. Troi?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: There was much fear in that room.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Paranoia, if you ask me. But of   what?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: I cannot say. Nor do I feel their   fear was focused. I sensed that   all were not concerned for the   same reason.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Data?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: There are undoubtedly survivors   from the Odin on this planet,   Commander.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: I agree. Otherwise, why would   they be so circumspect?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: As the Mistress Beata is so fond   of saying -- good question.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: What do we do if they elect to   deny the existence of any   survivors?
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Let's not look for problems.
scene: 13   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: I want all departments prepared   for a warp six trip to the Neutral   Zone as soon as the away team   completes its mission.
Trouble, Captain?
Insurance. Romulan battlecruisers   have been detected near one of   our border posts. They've   requested assistance as soon as   we are available.
Captain Picard!
Report, Mister Crusher.
We, ah, finished our ski lesson,   sir... and it kinda just happened,   sir.
On the Enterprise, Mister Crusher,   nothing "just happens."       What is that smell?
Hmm, yes... slightly reminiscent   of Night-Blooming Throgni,   Captain. From home.       Quite stimulating, wouldn't you   say?
No.
I can't smell anything. I'm   a little congested...
Don't let this "just happen"   again, Mister Crusher.
Yes, sir!!
Interesting. An alcohol-based   synthetic, artificially   reproducing a floral scent.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: It is called perfume, Data.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: The purpose of which is... ?
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Certain cultures consider perfume   an aphrodisiac.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: I am unfamiliar with that term.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: An aphrodisiac is something   designed to stimulate or enhance   sexual pleasure.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: How does stimulation of the   olfactory nerve affect the   enjoyment of sex?
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: The Elected One will see you now.
scene: 17   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: You claim you intend to remove   these survivors from our planet.   Are you prepared to give us your   solemn word on that?
We are.
You should know that the vote was   not unanimous. Some among us are   suspicious.
Yet, the majority feel that we   have no choice but to trust you.
We don't understand the source   of your misgivings, Mistress, but   we appreciate your faith in us.
Make certain that our faith has   not been misplaced.       There are four survivors from the   ship you call the Odin. All male.   Their leader is a man who calls   himself Ramsey.
If you'll bring these men to us,   we'll have them off your planet   immediately.
If they were mine to deliver, I   would do so without hesitation.   Unfortunately, their hiding place   has long eluded us.
Hiding place? Why are they in   hiding?

Because they are fugitives on   Angel One! And the sooner we are   rid of them, the better!       When these men arrived seven years   ago, they accepted our hospitality   quickly enough. But gradually,   they grew restive. Making   unreasonable demands, going   against the natural order -- there   seemed to be no end to the trouble   they created.
Using the technology of the   Enterprise, we might be able to   find these men.
I assumed as much. But be warned,   Counselor --       -- these men are dangerous.
This is worse than Hesperan   Thumping Cough. What is it, Mom?

You and your friend probably   picked up something on the Quazulu   Eight field trip last week.   Whatever it is may have been   activated by your exposure to the   cold ski environment of the   Holodeck.
But the transporter biofilter is   supposed to kill stuff like that.
If this is our first contact, it   wouldn't have been programmed into   the biofilter computer yet.
Mom...
Sickbay to Captain Picard.
Picard here.
Wesley and one of his friends have   contracted some form of   respiratory ailment -- most likely   a viral infection.
Is it contained?
I believe so. I've isolated the   twelve students who were on the   field trip where I believe the   problem began.
How contagious is it?
Unknown. Nor do I have a clue   as to how it's transmitted.
Please stay with it, Doctor.   Starfleet has important business   for us as soon as the away team   returns. I don't relish having my   crew infected.
At the moment, my only suggestion   is that all crew avoid any   cold-weather Holodeck simulations   until further notice.
Agreed. And keep me advised.
Data, how can we best go about   finding Mister Ramsey and the   other survivors?
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Assuming the survivors have   retained some remnants of their   lives aboard the Odin, we might   not have a difficult task. If   we can isolate something unique   to the survivors -- perhaps an   element not otherwise found on   Angel One -- we can utilize the   Enterprise scanners.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Mister Data will need access to   your library.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Our library is far too   sophisticated for a man to   comprehend.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: I am an android, Mistress, though   anatomically, I am a fully   functioning male.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: An amusing notion. Perhaps you   could teach our males a thing or   two.       Trent -- see to the android's   needs.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Do not forget your promise.
scene: 27   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Bridge to Captain Picard.
Go ahead, Lieutenant.
The away team has requested that   we scan the planet surface for   traces of platinum.
Have Mister La Forge break fixed   orbit and initiate a search   pattern.
Aye, Captain.       Geordi.
Search pattern initiated now.
This is all quite unnecessary,   Doctor.       I'm merely fatigued.
Because you are very ill, Captain.   You have the virus.       Captain, in my opinion, you are   no longer physically able to   effectively command this vessel.
Don't be ridiculous, Doctor. I've   got an away team down there, in   less-than-friendly territory, not   to mention an appointment with the   several Romulan battlecruisers...
You have an appointment in your   cabin, Captain. With your bed.
Is that an order?
Yes.
I guess I'm better at giving   orders than taking them.
I think I may sneeze...
A Klingon sneeze?!
Only kind I know.
Lieutenant La Forge -- you have   command until further notice.   Please make the proper entries   in the ship's log.
Aye, sir.
Scanners indicate a platinum   trace. Should I notify the away   team?
Make it so.
The Enterprise reports a possible   location for Mister Ramsey and   the other survivors.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: So soon? I'm impressed with your   haste.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: I am suspicious of it.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: You've had your opportunity to   object, Ariel. You were in the   minority.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: Excuse me, Mistress. I have   matters to attend to elsewhere.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: With your permission, we'd like   to begin our search immediately.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: By all means.       But I'm sure that Counselor Troi   and the others can do that without   you.       If I recall, you had a gesture   of goodwill you wished to give   me... ?
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: That can certainly wait until   we've recovered the survivors.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: Are you suggesting that the women   in your party are incapable of   performing this task without the   help of a man?
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: Not at all. Lieutenant Yar and   Counselor Troi are completely   qualified.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: How generous you are with your   praise.       Inform them you will remain here   with me.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: Riker to Lieutenant Yar.
scene: 32   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - NIGHT

quote: This is Yar.
Tasha - you'll be leading the team   without me.
Commander... ?
In the interest of diplomatic   relations, I'll remain with   Mistress Beata while you conduct   your search.
Certainly, sir.
Relax. We have much to discuss.
Set phasers to stun.
Is that really necessary?
A justified precaution, Counselor.   Mistress Beata observed that   Mister Ramsey and his men were   dangerous.
Lieutenant Yar to Enterprise.
Go ahead, Tasha.
Three to beam to the location of   that platinum trace, Geordi.
Coordinates set.
Energize!
Welcome. I've been expecting you.
Picard to bridge.
Pardon me.
La Forge here, Captain.
Status report, please.
Eighty-two more reported cases   of the virus, sir. Doctor Crusher   has converted the Holodeck into   an isolation ward.
And the --
-- away team?
No recent contact, Captain. But   I've informed them of the medical   situation up here and the growing   Romulan threat to our Neutral Zone   outpost.
Keep me--       --advised. You'll have the bridge   until Commander Riker returns.
Engineering reports a computer   malf...
Sorry, I'm... getting sick.
I'm sure half the ship knows that   by now. Report to Sickbay.
Engineering to bridge.
La Forge here.
Sir, the computer won't accept   the variant climate controls   Doctor Crusher wants in the   quarantine areas.
I'm on my way.
With all respect, Lieutenant,   there are other people to do that   job now.
bridge to Engineering. Lieutenant   Wong knows the system. I'm sure   she'll be able to resolve all   problems.
I'll ask her to look at it right   away, sir.
Worf...
Thanks for the advice.
We haven't much time, Mister   Ramsey. The Enterprise has urgent   business elsewhere.
Certainly we have time for a   drink.
How did you find me?

Actually, it was quite simple.   I accessed all possible elements   available to the crew of the Odin,   cross-referenced those to elements   endemic to Angel One, then   eliminated the common   denominators. Angel One has no   platinum. Enterprise scanners   did the rest.
Platinum, was it?
My wings. I kept them for their   sentimental value.
Where are the other survivors,   Mister Ramsey?
Oh, they're nearby. Packing, as   a matter of fact, since we can   no longer remain here. As the   unofficial leader of our little   group, I've been chosen to speak   for us all.
Marooned seven years on an alien   planet. Rather than excitement   or anticipation at being rescued,   I sense a feeling of calm in you.
What is it you think you're   rescuing me from? My shipmates   and I have all taken wives. A   few even have children. You can't   "rescue" a man from the place he   calls his home.
... Why were you so hesitant at   first to tell us about the Odin   survivors?

Simply because Ramsey and his men   are anarchists. Tampering with   the laws of nature. Obsessed with   spreading untruths, and   encouraging dissent among our   people. I had to be certain you   weren't here to fuel their   struggle.
It's not our place to interfere   in the domestic affairs of other   societies.

Not you, perhaps, because you   understand a man's place. But   Ramsey is not so well-mannered.       Sometimes I fear that it is   actually the men who are the   clever ones, enjoying all that   life has to offer while we women   devote ourselves to the drudgery   of making life work.
In our society, men and women   share equally in all that life   has to offer.
Don't misunderstand me, Riker.   I'd be the last to imply that men   are in any way inferior to women.   But, after all, men are... men --   with a natural place in the scheme   of things.
We gave up those distinctions   centuries ago. In our world,   equality among the sexes is so   well established, we no longer   consider it an issue.
You deny that differences exist   between men and women?
We not only acknowledge the   differences. We delight in them.
That's so like a man. So   emotional. What would we do   without you... ?
Thank you, Trent.
You may go.
With compliments of the USS   Enterprise.
It's called an Albeni meditation   crystal.
Very impressive.
And now, of course, I must repay   you in kind.

... Five months in a rescue pod   no bigger than this room is an   eternity I hope none of you ever   have to face. When we finally   made it here, we all thought we'd   died and gone to heaven. You've   seen the women of the planet --   tall and strong and lovely.
But once the newness wore off,   we started to see how men on this   planet were treated. No vote,   no opinions... no respect.
None of which is any longer your   concern, Mister Ramsey. Call the   others in, please. It's time to   leave.
Despite its problems, Lieutenant,   we like it here on Angel One.       We're not going anywhere.
But Mistress Beata --
Mistress Beata be damned! Her   wish is not my command. And   neither is yours. You can't force   us to go.

Mister Ramsey is correct,   Counselor. The Odin was not a   starship, which means its crew   is not bound by the Prime   Directive. If he and the other   survivors wish to stay here, there   is absolutely nothing we can do.
Bridge to Sickbay -- how are you   Doing, Doctor?
We have more sick than we do beds.
I've been forced to confine over   three hundred to their private   quarters.
We're going to be seriously   undermanned if we're forced to   engage the Romulans in battle.

The Romulans are your problem,   Lieutenant. Trying to find an   innoculant is mine. This virus   mutates every twenty minutes.   On the positive side, the virus   is debilitating -- but so far we   haven't had any fatalities.
If this continues, there'll be   no one left to run the ship.
If it continues, no one will be   healthy enough to care.
Lieutenant Yar to Enterprise.
Enterprise, go ahead.
Prepare to beam three back to our   previous location, Geordi. After   we regroup with Commander Riker,   we'll return to the ship.

Suggest you make that on the   double. We have a real medical   emergency brewing up here. A   third of the crew is down. And   the latest report from the Neutral   Zone outpost is that more Romulan   battlecrusiers are entering the   area.
I'll inform the commander.       One thing before we go. You said   you were expecting us. Why?
I'm sorry. I can't tell you.
We wish you well, Mister Ramsey.
Energize!
They are gone.
It is such a refreshing change   to be with a man who knows what   he wants.
You mean without a woman having   to tell him?
Exactly! I knew you were bright   enough to understand. Women, by   our very nature, want only what   is best for their men.
Men are not objects to be   possessed, Mistress Beata.
Of course they're not. It was   merely a figure of speech.
Enter.
Why do you bother me?
Forgive the disturbance, Elected   One...
I expect so little from this sorry   excuse for a man. Perhaps even   that much is too much...
What is so important you find it   necessary to intrude on my   privacy?
They have returned, Mistress.   But without Ramsey or the others.
Your advanced technology has   proven inadequate?
What happened, Troi?
Mister Ramsey and the other   survivors refuse to leave.
But you promised!
I'm sorry. There's nothing else   we can do.
I am sorry as well.
Since you refuse to take them with   you, I am left with no choice...   but to sentence them all to death.
Enter.
It looks horrible, tastes worse --   but it's absolutely guaranteed to   make you feel better.
Knew you'd like it.       New cologne?
Same... you gave me last birthday.
Uh-uh, different. Like something   I smelled earlier. Something...   I don't know... like a flower I   remember. Something Klingon, I   think.
Lieutenant Worf and I... detected   a similar scent when we bumped   into... your son at the Holodeck.

It's that smell! That must be   how the virus travels!       An airborne microbe whose sweet   scent inspires deep inhalation...       ... And once inside the body,   becomes this damned virus!       I have a great deal of work to   do.
You are excused, Doctor.
What's the latest on the   Enterprise's medical situation?
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Doctor Crusher feels the virus   will undoubtedly run unchecked   through the entire ship's   contingent. Attempts to develop   an innoculant have so far ended   in failure. Lieutenant La Forge   still has the Conn pending your   return.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: What about the Romulans in the   Neutral Zone?
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: The border outpost reports a   contingent of seven Romulan   battlecruisers within sensor   range. The USS Berlin has   answered their distress call, and   is standing by. However, should   hostilities erupt, the outpost   and the starship will be   outgunned. It is felt that the   Enterprise's presence in the area   will be a vital show of force.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Some show of force. The   Enterprise may be able to fly on   autopilot. But with that virus   knocking down our crew, we're   going to be in sorry shape if   things turn ugly.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: The Romulans won't know our   strength, Lieutenant.       It's time for us to leave this   place.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: It feels terribly wrong to leave   while Beata is determined to   execute those people.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: She has to find them first.   Ramsey and his bunch have been   fugitives for years. I suspect   he's pretty good at evading   capture. As cold as it sounds   we're going to have to treat this   mission as if it never happened.   Everything will remain exactly   as it was before we arrived.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Something is wrong.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Your presence on Angel One no   longer amuses me.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Amusement was never our intention,   Mistress.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Before you go back to your ship,   there is something I wish you to   see.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: We were no harm to anyone. Why   did you tell them where to find   us?
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: Don't blame them, Ramsey. You   brought this upon yourself.   You... and the traitor.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: One doesn't need the technology   of the Enterprise to follow   Mistress Ariel sneaking off to   warn her husband.       Let her stand with him now...
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: ... For tomorrow they will die   together.
scene: 54   INT. ANGEL ONE GREAT HALL - NIGHT

quote: You're out of commission, Geordi.   Report to your quarters.
Can't leave my post... until I'm   relieved.
I've been aboard the Enterprise   long enough to know she's designed   to run herself.
But the innoculant --
I can do my research on the   computers here.
Then I can convalesce here.
You claim to be an advanced   society, yet you resort to tyranny   and executions in order to   suppress those who don't share   your views.
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: I don't expect you to understand.
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Why? Because I'm only a man?
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: You'll accomplish nothing with   that attitude.
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Mistress Beata, if you could avoid   executing Ramsey and his   followers, would you do so?
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Is that not the way of an advanced   society?
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Then let us talk to men from the   Odin one last time. Let me try   to convince them to leave with   us.
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: But what of the others? Their   minds have been poisoned. Will   you also include those from this   planet who unwisely chose to   follow Ramsey and his group?
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Yes. All of them.
scene: 58   INT. ANGEL ONE EXECUTIVE OFFICE - NIGHT

quote: Mistress Beata is giving you a   second chance. We're prepared   to take your entire group with   us.
That's very kind of you, sir, but   we're not going.
Haven't you been paying attention,   Ramsey? You're scheduled to be   executed tomorrow.

We don't want to die. We don't   want to leave, either. I'm not   Academy educated, but I've studied   a little history. The ancient   Christians faced their lions, the   natives of the African continent   faced their suppressors.
Even the women of the twentieth century   chose to settle for nothing but   full equality.
There's no time to debate the   issues, Ramsey. We're taking you   with us whether you choose to go   or not.
Excuse me, Commander, but removing   any of these people against their   will would be a violation of   several Starfleet regulations,   not the least of which would be   the Prime Directive.
I realize that, Data.       But I'd rather be facing a court   martial than trying to live with   the guilt of leaving these people   to their deaths.       Commander Riker to Enterprise.
This is the Enterprise.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: Things must be worse up there than   we thought.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: Doctor, where is Lieutenant La   Forge?
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: He's right here, Will, but he's   in no shape to be here.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: We're on our way, Doctor.   There'll be fourteen to beam up.   Two groups, five each. I'll be   in the last group of four.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: I'm afraid I can't allow that,   Will. The virus is totally out   of control. Until I know exactly   what I'm dealing with, I can't   let anyone new be exposed.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: There are people facing certain   death down here, Doctor.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: They could well be facing the same   thing up here, Will. I have no   idea what effect living on Angel   One might have on a person's   immune system. I'm sorry.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: Understood.       Doctor -- would this virus have   any effect on Data?
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: None that I can imagine.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: You're going back alone, Data.   We have no idea what the Romulans   plan to do to that outpost.   You're going to have to get the   Enterprise to the Neutral Zone   before it's too late.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: That's a direct order, Mister Data.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: Neutral Zone before it is too   late. Understood, Commander.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: This is Data, standing by to beam   up.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: And what of them?
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: I don't know, Deanna.
scene: 61   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE - (INTERCUT AS NEEDED)

quote: Mistress Beata invites you to   witness this morning's   reaffirmation of Angel One's moral   imperative.
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Is that supposed to be the fancy   name for murder on this planet?
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Send Mistress Beata our regrets.
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: The Elected One will not look   fondly upon --
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Enterprise to Commander Riker.
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: They are still here?
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: This is Commander Riker.
scene: 65   INT. ANGEL ONE - GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: I gave you a direct order to head   for the Neutral Zone immediately.   Explain the delay.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: To be precise, Commander, you   ordered me to reach the Neutral   Zone "before it is too late."   I have computed the length of time   the border outpost and USS Berlin   can safely withstand a Romulan   attack... deducted our time to   destination at maximum warp speed.   That leaves Doctor Crusher with   forty-eight more minutes to   complete her research and develop   an innoculant to the virus.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: Which means there's still time   for us to do something.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: Forty-eight minutes... I think   we're down to splitting hairs.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: Splitting hairs is a figure of   speech I recognize, Commander.   Speaking for those whose hair is   soon to be split, forty-eight   minutes may make a great deal of   difference.       Excuse me -- forty-seven minutes.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: Perhaps, Data, just perhaps.       Thanks for following my orders   so precisely, Data. Riker out.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: On second thought, Trent, we would   be honored to watch your moral   imperative in action.
scene: 66   INT. ENTERPRISE - MAIN BRIDGE (INTERCUT AS DESIRED)

quote: Sickbay to bridge.
Go ahead, Doctor.
Bingo, Data.
Bingo? I fail to see the   relevance, Doctor. Is that not   a reference to an ancient Earth   game?
It's also a reference to success,   Data. I've got the innoculant.
Excellent, Doctor. And we still   have a margin of seventeen   minutes. I will inform the away   team immediately.       Enterprise to Commander Riker.
We are ready to have you beamed   up, Commander.
scene: 72   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Data, I want you to lock the   transporter on the holding area   where they're keeping Ramsey and   the others. If we don't hear from   Beata in the next ten minutes,   you are to begin the beam up   sequence, five at a time. The   away team will beam up last.
scene: 72   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Understood, Commander. Enterprise   out.
scene: 72   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: The Elected One wishes to see you.
scene: 72   INT. ANGEL ONE GUEST QUARTERS - DAY

quote: Welcome home.
It's good to be back. Is everyone   recovering?
Slowly... but yes.
Enter.
How are you feeling, sir?
On the mend, thank you. Tell me   about Angel One.
Set coordinates for the Neutral   Zone, Mister Data. We have a call   to pay on the Romulans.
Coordinates set, Commander. On   your mark --
As Captain Picard would say --   make it so, Mister Data.
